p: We have seen that C.albicans was prominent in the age group 30–39 ( p = 0.058). Coinfections were mostly observed in women aged between 18 and 29 years, while women aged 50 and above were either not colonized (56%) by the studied pathogens or colonized by a single pathogen (25%) (Fig. 3). However, no association was observed between the age group and coinfections.
